Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, its a dump!”
Reviews.Author: ldasz
Reviews.Content: This place is now called Economy Lodge Inn & Suites... I knew this place was going to be a dump, by reading all the bad reviews, but we didn't have much of a choice... I booked it in July for a wedding (wedding was 11/12/11), got a discounted rate (yeah right) for the wedding $155.39 (tax incl)... that part even made me sicker! We all tried to book somewhere else, but we didn't have much of a choice... considering all the hotels were booking a 2 night min... due to U of I having their father's day weekend and a Illini game.... that should really be against the law, that 2 night min. crap! Back to the hotel, I am not even sure I can call it that... I was afraid to walk on the carpet in my bare feet... gross.... I am pretty sure the sheets and the towels were clean though... and we didn't come home with any bug bites, thank god... everything was just dirty and very old.... 2 microwaves stacked on each other, the bottom one didn't work anymore, but it was bolted down... so what they couldn't remove it??? wtf???? are you kidding me??? the shower/tub was clean, which I couldn't quite believe... the vanity where the sink was kind of gross... and all the baseboard in the whole room and bathroom... yuk.... I guess... I really wanted to turn around and just go home, but we had drank too much to do that... I think that probably helped us sleep better too... We went to Bob Evans for breakfast... decided to skip their free deluxe breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “I've slept in some dives but this takes the cake!”
Reviews.Author: RJ D
Reviews.Content: First off...I never write reviews for anything, but this experience prompted me to take a few minutes in the hope of sparing others the miserable experience. Second...I am a pretty no frills type of person. I stayed here during a hunting trip with a couple buddies. We just wanted a roof over our heads between hunting days. We got the roof, but not much else. This was the single worst hotel I've ever stayed in hands down. Filthy room, stains on carpet, stains on sheets, pillow-cases, and the mattresses themselves looked like they were dredged from the bottom of a river. The room smelled pretty bad on its own, but even worse since they used a febreeze-like spray to try and cover it up. The door to our room had about a 3/4" gap under it...open to the elements. The bathroom was a mess...door wouldn't close, mold & mildew growing in the common places (shower tiles & fixtures) and also in some uncommon spots (light switches, electric outlets, etc.). There was some questionable activity going on all night as well...a pretty steady stream of people showing up in groups of between 6-10 at a time, loitering around in the parking lot, and hanging out in front of the rooms (which were occupied by guests...including us) at ground level and on the 2nd floor balcony. This hotel was definitelt a gathering place for some reason...not sure what though. There was a goup leaning aginst our window drinking and smoking from about midnight until 4:00am. We considered telling them to scram, but it was a bit intimidating having large groups of people who weren't hotel guests loitering about and we weren't interested in getting into any confrontations (it looked like things could get ugly quickly if we did). It was very dirty and I felt pretty unsafe here. This place was really, really bad. I agree with the other reviewers...I would seriously prefer sleeping in my car than to ever stay at this hotel again. Bad, Bad, Bad. On the plus side though...I did not get lice or bedbugs (perhaps because this hotel was too dirty for even the lice and bedbugs to stay).

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE BOOKING!”
Reviews.Author: GROSS7777
Reviews.Content: Sleep in your car if you have to but NOT this place. Got the SUITE thinking it might be better. CAME HOME WITH BUG BITES ALL OVER!!!!! My neck and wrists and ankles. Carpet dirty and smelly. GARBAGE IN OUR BATHROOM GARBAGE CAN!!!! ick! Bolt on door was broken off. TV missing chanenel changer and other room TV not programmed to work. Only 2 towels for four people. Spend the extra #30.00 and go anywhere else except this place. I have 4 more years of visiing Champaign and I will sleep in my car before I will EVER stay at this hole. Very rude....don't drink any juice in morning, they make it in a bathtub in back room....UCK!!! PLEASE TRUST ME...My husband and children were so mad at me!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid1289
Reviews.Content: Should have read these reviews before I booked this hotel! Read only 5 reviews and had the same exact experiences as all of them. Credit card charged 48 hours before arrival, dirty, disgusting room, bugs, broken furniture, felt very unsafe. Very rude new-owner (?) who asked" what I was going to do about it?" when I complained, since I had a two week cancellation time. Didn't spend 5 minutes in the room and found a different hotel. I travel for business every other week and I have never had this bad of an experience.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE COCKROACHES LIVE HERE”
Reviews.Author: CowBelly8
Reviews.Content: To all travelers, Do not stay in this hotel you are better off sleeping on the street or in your car. We placed our items in the room, and went to visit family members. After four hours we come back to room 108 to find cockroaches crawling around the bathroom, walls, and beds. We also noticed that the air conditioner was not working (after reading another post when we left we realized it has not been working for a year). When we saw the cockroaches we packed up all our stuff and headed out to stay with family. DO NOT ever stay here!! No amount of money is worth staying in this place. I strongly encourage you to stay elsewhere, and do not listen to the the reviews that give this hotel a good rating. They are probably staff members writing on here. This hotel is the worst possible place a person could stay. I strongly advise you to stay away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you love Cockroaches & Spiders”
Reviews.Author: modette99
Reviews.Content: I pulled in after 17 hours of driving from CO to MI on 9-14-2010. I should of listened to my gut, I've always had bad experiences with Econo Lodge's....yep never again. The check in was easy, but when I took all my things from the car to the room and started to look around I noticed cockroaches dead on the carpet, I kicked their bodies under the bed, and towards the walls to make a path to the bathroom. I then noticed all the dead roaches around around the toilet and also spiders, however the spiders where alive till I stepped on them. 17 hours driving and I just did not want to deal with moving rooms or complaining...I just wanted to sleep so I checked the bed and it seemed fine. The AC unit was okay as far as cold air but so old I do not think it worked all that well. So I opened the refrigerator to help cool the room down. The TV remote had a good battery but was not programmed to the TV so I just went to sleep. When I woke up that was when I noticed that this place was bad. There were thousands of dead bugs in the bathroom light/fan unit. So I went to turn the bath water on and it came out black, obviously it had not been run for a long time. Immediately when I turned on the bath faucet water came out of that light/fan unit above the toilet. I turned the water off and it stopped, I turned it on again and it started again to which I shrugged and took my shower anyways (too bad if this place burns down was my thought). I did complain and showed the girl the photos, she gave the typical response of why did you wait to complain!!! Obviously she has never driven for 17 hours. She told me a manager will call me later...yeah right. As soon as she told me that a Pakistani came out of the back office to which I pointed at and said "He looks like he can help me" knowing it was probably the cheap owner. The most he would do is $10.49 off bringing the total to $31.46. Still pretty pricey for a hole in the wall. Oh, and I did show him the photo's and he did not care. He even asked why I waited, technically I did not use the room till my fully paid time (I had 5 hours left as checkout was at 11am) but to him I used the room till the end, he also said I might of put the bugs there...really dude from the reviews here it looks like you are just another cheap foreign motel owner. Yeah, I carry bugs around to save a whopping $10.49. Maybe that is how it is handled in Pakistan but I have a feeling most Americans do not try to con people in that manor. He refused to go to the room with me to see it so i could show him the leak, the bugs and what not...why not go with the customer are you not concerned? Oh, wait you knew the room was awful so there was no need to go look at it. Heck I stayed in a hole in Dominican Republic but you expect that there....not here in a modern country. I know people will read this and say why did you stay, I guess having lived in 3rd world countries like Pakistan I have thick skin. However enough is enough and I was happy to pay $64 on my way home...I'm too old to save a buck, and really did I save anything!!! I would think the board of health would be interested in this place. I'm still thinking of doing a charge back on my credit card and providing them with the photos....one of the few times I think the Motel needs punished and no better way then doing a charge back. Check out my pictures to see the problems. Oh, and it was aburto.IL098 that checked me in and out of room 145.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing Motel”
Reviews.Author: basketball2010
Reviews.Content: This motel was in very poor shape. Rooms were filty and smelled. I would not recommend this to another person or family passing thru the town . Towels were left in the shower which was an indication that the bathroom was not even cleaned from previous occupant. How gross is that! I couldn't wait to leave!! No recommendated at all. The price of it says it all :(

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE DUMP”
Reviews.Author: cathy1174
Reviews.Content: terrible dump and poor service. Front desk unfriendly and couldn't help with simple directions to main areas in the area. Rooms were terrible, dirty and overpriced for graduation weekend. I will never stay at this motel again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. It is a dump.”
Reviews.Author: ksizz
Reviews.Content: The room is absolutely filthy and worn. Specifically, the bed is tattered and has clearly not been replaced in many years. A stay here is not worth the $40 they charge. Seriously, fork out a couple of extra bucks and stay somewhere clean.

Reviews.Title: “Research and preview your choices before travel.”
Reviews.Author: micjpay517221p
Reviews.Content: AAA discount not applied. Hotel/Motel hold placed on debit visa without notification. Parking lot hotel entrance clean/clear on snow day. Rear entrance where room located Black ice spots/and snow. Room straightened up not clean. Hair on side of bathtub and on toilet around foot. Bed appeared clean with clean linen. Refrigerator and microwave in room. Heater/air conditioner in room temp had to be placed on 70 degrees to avoid overheating. Room quiet. Coffee maker in room and cups. TV older with poor reception - Direct TV. Motel needs serious update. I was very disappointed when I returned home and viewed onine listing of much nicer rooms available. Nite manager friendly. I was disappointed when I called the next day after departure to ask if an item was seen or located in room during clean up. The person answering the phone did not bother to have his staff check the room. He just said nothing was reported. They also have a menu for food "take out' that you can order from your room. They offer lite breakfast between 5am and 8am-. Any amenities that might have enhanced this experience - indoor pool, whirlpool tub etc. might have been nice. We would have paid more for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: argonauts52
Reviews.Content: This place was dirty and needs to be renovated. Dirty rooms and bedding. Dirty bathroom with cracked tiles. Furniture had burn holes in it. Disgusting. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “basic but ok”
Reviews.Author: amandapanda821
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel but it was alright. Really needs to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, if you can.”
Reviews.Author: 57-yr_old_couple
Reviews.Content: This was one of the last two rooms in Champaign during the U of IL graduation weekend, so we stayed there to the tune of $169. Were it not for the special weekend, we doubt they could get $40/night. Check in/out were okay. The continental breakfast was okay, but nothing special. The hotel and rooms are just old and show a lack of care. The room was not very clean and the carpet in front of the door was wet from a hard rain the night before. The smoke alarm was beeping when we checked in, so we requested that be corrected. Apparently they replaced the battery, but about 3:00 am it started beeping again. There was a 1.5-inch gap between the wall air conditioner and the wall which let in air and light. If you have a choice, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a low price. Don't expect too much, though.”
Reviews.Author: EMAmerica
Reviews.Content: My family rented two rooms last minute for a funeral that we came into town for. The hotel staff was accommodating when we had to call twice to change our date of arrival to a different date as we found out more about the funeral arrangements. The hotel could use a major update and renovation. Our room was fair. I have stayed in worse but I have definitely stayed in better. The air conditioner was missing the front cover and needs to be recharged - even on High Cool it felt like it was just using the fan function. There was a half bar of soap at the small ledge at the top of the shower and housekeeping fails to vacuum under the beds - upon arrival I looked under the bed and there were crumbs and a candy wrapper underneath. The hotel is quite dirty inside and out; the siding is filthy and could use a good powerwash. The breakfast runs from 5:00 am - 9:00 am. My brothers and I came down at 8:00 am and they had run out of waffle batter and most of the pasteries/bagels/bread. Upon inquiring about a refill of the breakfast items I was told that they had run out. The hotel should stock enough breakfast supplies to last the full four hours that it runs. The breakfast area does its job but is very small and with only an air conditioner unit similar to those in the rooms. It was like a sauna in there but I turned on the A/C during breakfast. The upside to this hotel is that if you are not looking to spend a fortune and need a room just to sleep in (not to relax/enjoy) then this would be a fair hotel. I love that it is pet-friendly, too, and there is a grassy area to walk your pet. It felt safe and the location is GREAT - right off of the expressway and only a mile or so from the mall and the campus. The hotel is in major need of an update/renovation and housekeeping staff should be retrained on how to properly clean rooms. Staff was friendly but very unprofessional in appearance. They have an old computer in the breakfast area for guest use (15 minutes at a time) and have free wireless internet, which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel - Awful, Service - Commendable”
Reviews.Author: enginero
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip, my wife and I had the displeasure of getting tired enough from driving to stop in at this EconoLodge. As Choice Privileges members, we always try to stay at Choice hotels and we have had very good luck with them over the years. This experience was contrary to the norm. The room was disgusting... - Carpets were stained and nasty - Shower was filthy with plenty of mildew/mold - Mattress was ancient and dirty - Fridge severly needed to be replaced. I'm not sure any amount of cleaning could have saved it. - Door locks needed to be replaced or preferably the entire door. If we hadn't been so tired from the drive, we definitely would have left. However, we braved it out and ended up sleeping in our clothes. I think you'll know why when you see from the picture of the mattress. In addition to the state of the room, the area that the hotel is in is a little questionable. However, I am not one to condemn a hotel for location. My opinions are focused on things that the hotel management and staff can change and, in this case, the hotel is essentially being left in its' tattered shape. The one positive was that the front desk service we received was courteous. I also lodged a complaint with Choice Hotels and we were given a 30% credit for the stay, even though I never asked for a credit or refund. I thought that was a very stand-up thing to do. In the end, I hope the hotel management has plans for a massive clean-up project.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: UKCATNIP
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were coming back home on a long road trip only to find every hotel from Rockford IL to Champaign booked, when we finally reached the Econo Lodge at 3 am we were beyond tired. The staff was amazingly nice, the hotel is obviously being remodeled as it has normal older hotel wear and tear, our room was extremely clean. We had two phones, a microwave and a fridge. The bed was comfortable and the room was nice and cool. We only slept seven hours before heading back out, but it was well worth it. If I were to come through here again I would feel more than comfortable staying at the Econo Lodge again and the price could not be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Best econo Lodge I've visted ever”
Reviews.Author: meentzs
Reviews.Content: I travel A LOT and was impressed with my stay at this hotel. The price was so inexpensive I expected the worst, but I am always on a tight budget so I ran the risk. The surroundings are not visually impressive and there was the normal signs of hotel wear and tear as with a hotel of any standard, even some of the 4 star hotels I've stayed in. The staff were exceptionally helpful even printed out map quest directions to two different locations in town for me! The "free" breakfast was awesome, try the waffles if you visit! The room was decent, quiet and clean. I found out when I was checking out the hotel was under new management and is close to being completely remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: deeps123
Reviews.Content: I am a 25 year old female and came to champaign on a business trip. When I entered the room, there was this smell of cigarette everywhere although the room itself was a non-smoking room. Added to that, there was black powdery substance everywhere (on the carpet, also on the phone). The sheets and the comforters looked disgusting. The towels also were old and I didn't feel like using them, Thank god I bought my own. When I pulled the sheets, I saw stains everywhere on the bed. The bathroom was the only place that seemed OK (probably because people who stayed in these rooms didn't know the word "hygiene" and used the bathroom the least). The next day, I noticed many people outside my room drinking and talking loudly and I couldn't sleep. Since the rooms had internet, I looked up on tripadvisor to see the reviews on th hotel and was even more disappointed. The breakfast was also only mediocre. I shifted to another room on the second floor and it was much better (atleast better than the other room on the first floor). The hotel staff seemed nice, but seriously its high time they renovate the hotel and also increase the prices for staying to avoid all kinds of people staying there. Also, they better be strict about enforcing some policies not to disturb other people staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe feel, Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: ynnej
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms here for our 8 family members while on a trip to Champaign at the very end of December 2006. The staff are courteous and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located just off the interstate. The continental breakfast was pretty good, with juice and waffles. The rooms are very cheap. This hotel is in DESPERATE need of an update. All of the fairly small rooms are outside entry, and while we were there I observed a black male walking the hotel looking in windows and taking notes on a little notepad, while his accomplice waited in the car. The area has a very "ghetto" feel, and the empty parking lot beside the hotel (opposite where we stayed, fortunately) had a lot of undesirable traffic. The room doors are very old and have worn seals so often they don't close properly. The electronic locks are horribly worn and do not respond to the keycard until you run them through several times. Oddly, our room had a toilet paper dispenser, but the toilet didn't always want to flush, and my brothers' room flushed okay but didn't have a toilet paper dispenser. Every room is different. :) Additionally, part way through the morning the water heater went out. Now, I can put up with a lot of irritation at a hotel, but no hot water is one thing I can't deal with. When we called to notify the front desk, they were very apologetic, but this hotel has a case of good staff working in deplorable conditions. EconoLodge should be ashamed. Despite the excellent staff, I can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it was cheap at least”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, at $39 a night I wasn't expecting much, but we were doing a budget trip so cost was the first consideration. The Econolodge delivered. :) When we arrived there was no running water in the room. Asked the front desk about it and it was *then* they explained that it was being worked on and would be fixed before 5pm. Could have told us *before* we checked in, guys... The room was clean and everything (bar one light) worked. The room had new AC and, to be honest, it was the best inroom unit I've ever seen: quiet, easy to use, and did it's job well. The room wasn't, despite what we'd booked and asked for at checkin, a non-smoking. We didn't realise until the next day just *how* non-smoking it was when we found our bags and other things now smelled of cigarettes where they'd laid the night before. Breakfast was okay - functional chain "continental" style and nothing more. Room also didn't have any lock except the door deadbolt, and given the area of town it's in, we would have preferred an internal chain there as well. All in all, functional and I'd consider it again if I was wanting to save money & desperate. Otherwise, I'd spend the extra $7 and stay over the road at the newer Days Inn (which I didn't know about when I booked) or some such.

HotelInfo.Name: Economy Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 914 West Bloomington Road, Champaign, IL 61820
